title: Research
text:
My work focuses on applying advanced spatiotemporal methods to model and map the risk of Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTDs), including snakebite envenoming (SBE), soil-transmitted helminths (STH), and lyphatic filariais (LF), influencing policy and control strategies in low- and middle-income countries.

Mapping Snakebite Risk: Developed high-resolution spatiotemporal models to predict envenoming hotspots.
STH Control Strategies: Evaluated the impact of mass drug administration on soil-transmitted helminth prevalence.
LF Elimination: Designing elimination surveys to support the global program to eliminate lymphatic filariasis.

title: Dileepa Ediriweera
text:
I am a specialist researcher in spatiotemporal disease mapping, dedicated to addressing the health challenges of marginalized populations. I leverage model-based geostatistics to translate complex epidemiological data into high-resolution evidence for global policy and precision resource allocation.
As a Fellow of the Higher Education Academy (FHEA) with over a decade of teaching practice, I am committed to developing quantitative literacy among undergraduate and postgraduate trainees, mentoring the next generation of researchers, and designing specialist professional training for health practitioners and policymakers.

Thanks for checking out my personal web site!
